_gram:
({#kalpate, cakxpe, akxpat#},
{#akxpta, akalpizw; kalpizyate, kalpsyati-te#},
{#kalpituM, kaltpuM, kxpta#})
_meanings:
{@--1@} To be fit or
adequate for, result in, bring about,
accomplish, produce, tend to; (with
<ab>dat.</ab>); {#kalpase rakzaRAya#} <ls>Ś. 5. 8</ls>;  
{#paScAtputrErapahftaBaraH kalpate viSramAya#} <ls>V. 3. 1</ls>;
{#viBAvarI yadyaruRAya kalpate#} <ls>Ku. 5. 44</ls>,
<ls n="Ku.">6. 29</ls>; <ls n="Ku.">5. 79</ls>; <ls>Me. 55</ls>; <ls>R. 5. 13</ls>,  
<ls n="R.">8. 40</ls>: <ls>Ś. 6. 23</ls>; <ls>Bk. 22. 21.</ls>

{@--2@} To be
well managed or regulated, to 
succeed.

{@--3@} To become, happen, occur;
{#kalpizyate hareH prItiH#} <ls>Bk. 16. 12</ls>; <ls n="Bk.">9. 44</ls>, <ls n="Bk. 9.">45.</ls>

{@--10@}
To fall to the share. of.

{@--4@} To provide or furnish
with; <ls>Bh. 3. 95</ls>; <ls>R. 1. 94</ls>; <ls n="R.">5. 9.</ls>
